newsitem.title: UK: Ex-minister Shephard backs Hague in UK Tory race.
newsitem.headline: Ex-minister Shephard backs Hague in UK Tory race.

text.p: Former education secretary Gillian Shephard said she would vote for ex-Welsh secretary William Hague in Tuesday's second round of voting for a new leader of the main opposition Conservative party.
Shephard originally backed former social security secretary Peter Lilley, who withdrew after the first ballot last Tuesday.
There had been speculation that Shephard would throw her weight behind former finance minister Kenneth Clarke.

But she said in a statement that Hague, the favourite in the three-man race, had the experience and enthusiasm needed for the vital task of rebuilding the party and could help deliver change rapidly, smoothly and effectively.
